snippet: The number of people without jobs fell by 46,000. Analysis suggests most of the improvement was in London, where people were employed to prepare for the Olympic Games.
abstract: Britain reports the unemployment rate fell to 8.0 percent in the April-June period from 8.1 percent in the three months through May; number of people unemployed fell by 46,000, to 2.56 million; analysis suggests most of the improvement was in London, where people were employed to prepare for the Olympic Games.
lead_paragraph: The number of people without jobs fell by 46,000. Analysis suggests most of the improvement was in London, where people were employed to prepare for the Olympic Games.

headline.print_headline: British Job Market Defies Weak Economy
